page.title: 14Wildlife on or near the land
page.content: Foxes and badgers can both be seen quite a lot in our block.Badger scrapings are often seen in the area up to 1Km. west of Catesby church.Hares and rabbits are widespread,so are hedge hogs which are often accident victims on roads.Harvest mice and long-tailed field mice are seen in good nos.,as are field voles.Frogs,especially,and toads are often seen;sometimes whole'swarms' of little frogs go on the move.We found grass snakes too,but the only common bat is the pipistrelle.We saw quite a few weasels,and some stoats. We tried to work out what were the most common butterflies in our block;these were our'Top Ten':small tortoiseshell, peacock,red admiral,comma,painted lady, cabbage white,small white,black-veined white,brimstone and lesser blue.Near to the ground,we saw treecreepers,herons.
